intro: Ranunculus japonicus f. coloratus, commonly known as the Japanese buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to East Asia. It features showy, radially symmetrical flowers with five to eight bright yellow petals and a central cluster of stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and palmately lobed leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. The f. coloratus form is distinguished by its more vibrant and elongated petals compared to the typical species.
